section.title: Web App Configuration
section.para: is a Web application composed of one servlet acting as the single entry point for the application within the chosen Java-based application server. The recommended webapp general directory structure is described in the Installation Guide.

The web server uses a deployment descriptor file (actually an XML file) to find out deployment information about a particular web application. Although this should be configurable via the application server administration console, here's a reminder of the recommended deployment descriptor for the servlet:
section.programlisting: <web-app> <servlet> <servlet-name> gtp </servlet-name> <servlet-class> org.apache.turbine.Turbine </servlet-class> <init-param> <param-name>applicationRoot</param-name> <!-- Use <param-value>webContext</param-value> within the Web context --> <!-- Use the following syntax to set the application outside of the Web context --> <param-value>/var/appdata</param-value> </init-param> <init-param> <param-name>configuration</param-name> <param-value>/config/configuration.xml</param-value> </init-param> <load-on-startup>1</load-on-startup> </servlet> </web-app>
section.para: Notice that the 'applicationRoot' parameter set the root directory for the application configuration (webContext value means at the root of the Web context), and the 'configuration' parameter is used to point to the configuration presented in the following chapter.

section.title: Properties Files
Overview
section.para: is customisable through dedicated property files stored under the ./config directory under the root of the webapp directory tree:

listitem.para: configuration.xml is the master configuration file, that specifies the other properties files to be loaded. The path to these properties files must be adjusted.
turbine.properties focuses on technical low-level properties and services related to the technical framework, such as the database pool of connections and various default parameters.
torque.properties handles the database access setup.
environment.properties handles more application-level client customizable properties,
portal.properties handles more application-level core customizable properties,
fts.properties defines properties to connect to the GMS Server in case of MT798.

section.para: A fourth properties file Audit.properties can also be adjusted to tune the audit features: this is detailed in a following chapter. Additional properties files are shipped together with the portal, but should not be customized (all files under the ./config directory).

The two main properties files are given in a dedicated annex. Since they are heavily commented, their reading should be meaningful. We below focus on the important configuration parameters that can be tuned. Note that unless specified in the following descriptions, no property should be modified.
The interfaces related property files is described in the technical reference manual.

section.title: Naming Conventions
section.para: Both configuration files use property-value pairs. Some standard prefixes are applied to properties to classify them:

listitem.para: .url when the property is a URL
.file when the property is a file
.directory when the property is a directory.
.classname when the property is a qualified Java class name.
.interval when the property is a time interval in seconds

section.para: Note that all the paths to file names follow the Unix naming conventions (even if the application server is running under the Windows world), and are given relative to the webapp root.
Also note the comments lines are starting with the character #.

section.title: turbine.properties
section.para: This is the configuration file for Turbine.
Description : Below property related to LOG4J - LOGGING. Relative to applicationRoot

log4j.file = /config/log4j2.xmlDescription : Below property related to LOG4J - LOGGING. Watchdog delay in seconds. Default is 60 seconds. If specified 0 seconds which means no watchdog .Thread leak if watchdog activated!
Description : Below property related to ACCESS CONTROL LISTS. Through this property can specify the module to handle building AccessControlLists.
Description : Below property related to MODULE CACHING. This determines whether or not to cache the modules in memory. For development, turn this off. For production, turn this on.
module.cache=false If module.cache=true, then how large should make the hash tables by default will be provided through the below properties.

para.programlisting: action.cache.size=20 layout.cache.size=10 navigation.cache.size=10 page.cache.size=5 screen.cache.size=50 scheduledjob.cache.size=10

section.para: Description : This is the "classpath" for Turbine. In order to locate your own modules, you should add them to this path. For example, if you have com.company.actions, com.company.screens, com.company.navigations, then setting this would be "com.company,org.apache.turbine.modules". This path is searched in order. For example, Turbine comes with a screen module named "Login". If you wanted to have your own screen module named "Login", then you would specify the path to your modules before the others.
Description : This is the default screen to show to people when they first access the system. You can override this by specifying module.packages to include your own modules.
Description : This is the page that is shown on an incorrect login attempt. It is referenced in the LoginUser action. This is only used if there is no value for template.login.
Description : Login with questions and answer, and profile completion. Also includes terms and conditions acceptance.
Description : Chooses where to take the user after logout.This takes to a logout screen after logout, with a link to the home page.
Description : Chooses where to take the user after logout.This takes to a logout screen after logout, with a link to the home page.
Description : This is the default action to reset the user password.(requires GTPExtendedSessionValidator)
Description : This is the template that is used by the respective Template based ErrorScreen for displaying the error. If you are not using a Template based ErrorScreen, then this is ignored.
Description : This is the default error screen.
Description : This is the screen that is displayed when the user's web page is in an invalid state.

Description : Set the default Doctype. The default Doctype can be set by using the single strings: Html40Strict, Html40Transitional, or Html40Frameset. Additionally the default can be supplied as two strings separated by a comma giving the DTD and URI.
section.note: Default: ignored if not set to some value.
section.para: Description : This is the default action to log a user in. If you write your own implementation of the login action, make sure that you change this to reflect the new name.
section.programlisting: #default action to login an user with questions and answer, and profile completion, also includes terms and conditions acceptance action.login=GTPLoginUserQA #In case separate deployment for Bank, default action to log a bank user in action.login=GTPLoginBankUserQA #In case separate deployment for Customer, default action to log a bank user in action.login=GTPLoginCustUserQA # Additional login mode available action.login=GTPLoginUserSimple # Login for unique session per user action.login=GTPUniqueSessionLoginUser
section.para: Description : Below property allows to configure the max number of login attempts for an user.
Description : Below property allows to configure the password validity duration.
section.note: Below are additional properties used only with the GTPLoginUserQA.
section.programlisting: #Date in dd-mm-yyyy HH:MM (in 24 hrs) format terms_condition_date = 31-12-2011 14:00 #Number of questions stored in DB no.fact.questions.in.db = 5 #Number of opinion questions stored in DB no.opinion.questions.in.db = 10 #Number of fact questions to be displayed for password change # (must be less than or equal to number of fact questions stored in DB) no.fact.questions = 3 #Number of opinion questions to be displayed for password change #(must be less than or equal to number of opinion questions stored in DB) no.opinion.questions = 5 #Total number of fact questions to be answered correctly for password #change (must be less than or equal to number of fact questions to be #displayed for password change) no.fact.questions.answered = 3 #Total number of opinion questions to be answered correctly for password #change (must be less than or equal to number of opinion questions to #be displayed for password change) no.opinion.questions.answered = 5
section.para: Description : Below property is the default action to log a user out. If you write your own implementation of the logout action, make sure that you change this to reflect the new name.
section.programlisting: #Default logout action.logout=GTPLogoutUser # Login for unique session per user action.logout=GTPUniqueSessionLogoutUser #This class also extends on the original GTPLogoutUser class in that it saves the logout time information in the user profile, # and it puts some parameters used by the logout page in the request. action.logout=GTPExtendedLogoutUser
section.para: Description : If the following entry is set, the logout action will redirect to it.

Description : Below is the default action to validate whether or not a session is valid. For example, if you want to make sure if a user has already logged in or not.It allows the user to be presented with a timeout pop up, and also handles logout differently, allowing the user to be taken to a specific page defined in the screen.logout property. This class has to be used in conjunction with GTPExtendedLogout
Description : Below is the timeout in seconds for sessions. If left commented out, the servlet container's default timeout will be left as is(Unit : seconds).

Description : "session.idle.timeout" (Inactive Session Timer - alert dialog for idle time) Set session.idle.timeout less than the application server's timeout.This timeout is for the alert(dialog) not for the actual timeout. So that the dialog pops out 5 minutes before the actual timeout of the server
Description : Maximum Session Duration of the single session even if the user is active. User session will get inactive/invalid after this time even though the user is active.

Description : Maximum Session Duration Timer - alert dialog for max duration even if the user is active) Set session.max.duration.alert less than the session.max.duration timeout. This timeout is for the alert(dialog) not for the actual max duration timeout. The dialog pops out at the below defined time from the login-time to tell the User to save his/her data. Example: If the max duration timeout = 5400(90 min) then "session.max.duration.alert" can be 5100(85 min) So that the dialog pops out 5 minutes before the actual timeout of the server
Description : Below is the default action that builds up the AccessControlList for the individual users session.

Description : Set this value to true if you want to be able to submit multiple events to an Action by doing eventSubmit_do(action) and consider only events that have a non-empty, non-zero value. This is useful if you submit your form with JavaScript.
Description : Supplies Turbine with information about the database schema, which can simplify any required Peer classes.
section.programlisting: #For Oracle database database.maps.builder=com.misys.portal.util.db.map.TurbineMapBuilder #For MSSql database and MySQL database database.maps.builder=com.misys.portal.util.db.map.IDBrokerTurbineMapBuilder
section.para: Description : Whether the web server is able to use SSL. Links in Turbine can check this property to determine if SSL can be used.
Description : SERVICES : Classes for Turbine Services should be defined here.
Format: services.[name].classname=[implementing class]
To specify properties of a service use the following syntax:
Below are the list of default services provided by Turbine which are being used by Portal
Below are the list of portal services being used
section.programlisting: #An implementation of ComponentService which loads all the components given in the #turbine.properties file. services.ComponentService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.component.GTPComponentService #Default service : services.ComponentService.classname=org.apache.turbine.services.component.TurbineComponentService #The RunData Service provides the implementations for RunData and related interfaces required by #request processing. It supports different configurations of implementations, which can be selected by #specifying a configuration key. It may use pooling, in which case the implementations should implement #the Recyclable interface. services.RunDataService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.rundata.GTPRunDataService #Default service : services.RunDataService.classname=org.apache.turbine.services.rundata.TurbineRunDataService # This class provides a context service when the application is run in a ServletContainer. It is mainly #a wrapper around the ServletContext API. services.ServletService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.servlet.GTPServletService #Default service : services.ServletService.classname=org.apache.turbine.services.servlet.TurbineServletService #Service for a cron like scheduler. services.SchedulerService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.services.schedule.GTPSchedulerService #Default service : services.SchedulerService.classname=org.apache.turbine.services.schedule.TurbineSchedulerService #This service uses for File upload services.UploadService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.upload.PortalUploadService #Default service : services.UploadService.classname=org.apache.turbine.services.upload.TurbineUploadService # Following service required by Turbine. Uncomment the line below in order to activate one single session per user services.SecurityService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.security. AdapterForTurbineSecurityService #The SessionService allows thread-safe access to the current sessions of the current context. The #session objects that are cached by this service are obtained through a listener, which must be #configured via your web application's web.xml deployement descriptor. services.SessionService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.session.UniqueSessionService #Default service : services.SessionService.classname=org.apache.turbine.services.session.TurbineSessionService # An XSLt service that caches stylesheets services.XSLTService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.services.XSLTCachingService #Default service : services.XSLTService.classname=org.apache.turbine.services.xslt.TurbineXSLTService #This is the default GTP template Service services.GTPDefaultTemplateService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.template. GTPDefaultTemplateEngineService #Audit the user's action. The Audit record is saved in database, in order to make sure there will #be a record inserted in the Audit tray, whether the processing fails or succeeds The Audit record #is whether fetched from the data if already created (and the context typically adjusted with the #new one), or built after analysing the data parameters. The status is the general status of the action. services.AuditService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.services.GTPAuditService
section.para: Description : RUN DATA SERVICE - Default implementations of base interfaces for request processing. Additional configurations can be defined by using other keys in the place of the <default> key.
section.programlisting: #This interface extends the RunData interface with methods specific to the needs of GTP. services.RunDataService.default.run.data=com.misys.portal.services.rundata.DefaultGTPRunData #Default service provided by Turbine for parsing cookies services.RunDataService.default.cookie.parser=org.apache.turbine.util.parser.DefaultCookieParser #DefaultParameterParser is a utility object to handle parsing and retrieving the data passed via the #GET/POST/PATH_INFO arguments. services.RunDataService.default.parameter.parser=com.misys.portal.services.rundata. GTPParameterParser #Defau service : services.RunDataService.default.parameter.parser=org.apache.turbine.util.parser. DefaultParameterParser
section.para: Description : ASSEMBLER BROKER SERVICE -A list of AssemblerFactory classes that will be registered with TurbineAssemblerBrokerService
section.programlisting:
#A screen factory that attempts to load a java class from the module packages defined in the turbine.properties services.AssemblerBrokerService.screen=com.misys.portal.services.assemblerbroker. GTPJavaScreenFactory # Default service : services.AssemblerBrokerService.screen=org.apache.turbine.services.assemblerbroker.util.java. JavaScreenFactory
#Following turbine service used for AssemblerBroker services.AssemblerBrokerService.action=org.apache.turbine.services.assemblerbroker.util.java. JavaActionFactory #Following are the additional Assembler Broker related properties services.AssemblerBrokerService.layout=org.apache.turbine.services.assemblerbroker.util.java. JavaLayoutFactory services.AssemblerBrokerService.page=org.apache.turbine.services.assemblerbroker.util.java. JavaPageFactory services.AssemblerBrokerService.navigation=org.apache.turbine.services.assemblerbroker.util.java. JavaNavigationFactory services.AssemblerBrokerService.scheduledjob=org.apache.turbine.services.assemblerbroker.util. java.JavaScheduledJobFactory
section.para: Description : TEMPLATE SERVICE -Roughly, the number of templates in each category.Defaults: layout=2, navigation=10, screen=50
section.programlisting:
services.TemplateService.layout.cache.size=2 services.TemplateService.navigation.cache.size=10 services.TemplateService.screen.cache.size=50
# These are the mapper classes responsible for the lookup of Page, Screen, Layout and Navigation classes according # to the supplied template Name. They also map template names on the Layout and Screen file names to be used. #services.TemplateService.mapper.page.class = org.apache.turbine.services.template.mapper.DirectTemplateMapper #services.TemplateService.mapper.screen.class = org.apache.turbine.services.template.mapper.ClassMapper #services.TemplateService.mapper.layout.class = org.apache.turbine.services.template.mapper.ClassMapper #services.TemplateService.mapper.navigation.class = org.apache.turbine.services.template.mapper.ClassMapper #services.TemplateService.mapper.layout.template.class = org.apache.turbine.services.template.mapper.LayoutTemplateMapper #services.TemplateService.mapper.screen.template.class = org.apache.turbine.services.template.mapper.ScreenTemplateMapper
# This is the default template #services.TemplateService.default.template=GTPDefaultTemplateService.gtp services.TemplateService.default.extension=gtp #services.TemplateService.page.template=DefaultPage #services.TemplateService.default.template=DefaultPage services.TemplateService.page.default=DefaultPage services.TemplateService.layout.default=GTPLayout
section.para: Description : PULL SERVICE -These are the properties for the Pull Service, the service that works in conjunction with the Turbine Pull Model API.
section.programlisting:
services.PullService.earlyInit= true
# This determines whether the non-request tools are refreshed # on each request (request tools aren't ever, because they're # instantiated for the request only anyway). services.PullService.tools.per.request.refresh=true
# These are tools that are placed in the context by the service # These tools will be made available to all your # templates. You list the tools in the following way: # # tool.<scope>.<id> = <classname> # # <scope> is the tool scope: global, request, session # or persistent (see below for more details) # <id> is the name of the tool in the context # # You can configure the tools in this way: # tool.<id>.<parameter> = <value> # # So if you find "global", "request", "session" or "persistent" as second # part, it is a configuration to put a tool into the toolbox, else it is a # tool specific configuration. # # For example: # # tool.global.ui = org.apache.turbine.util.pull.UIManager # tool.global.mm = org.apache.turbine.util.pull.MessageManager # tool.request.link = org.apache.turbine.services.pull.tools.TemplateLink # tool.request.page = org.apache.turbine.util.template.TemplatePageAttributes # # Then: # # tool.ui.skin = default # # configures the value of "skin" for the "ui" tool. # # Tools are accessible in all templates by the <id> given # to the tool. So for the above listings the UIManager would # be available as $ui, the MessageManager as $mm, the TemplateLink # as $link and the TemplatePageAttributes as $page. # # You should avoid using tool names called "global", "request", # "session" or "persistent" because of clashes with the possible Scopes. # # Scopes: # # global: tool is instantiated once and that instance is available # to all templates for all requests. Tool must be threadsafe. # # request: tool is instantiated once for each request (although the # PoolService is used to recycle instances). Tool need not # be threadsafe. # # session: tool is instantiated once for each user session, and is # stored in the user's temporary hashtable. Tool should be # threadsafe. # # authorized: tool is instantiated once for each user session once the # user logs in. After this, it is a normal session tool. # # persistent: tool is instantitated once for each user session once # the user logs in and is is stored in the user's permanent # hashtable. # This means for a logged in user the tool will be persisted # in the user's objectdata. Tool should be threadsafe and # Serializable. # # Defaults: none
tool.request.link=org.apache.turbine.services.pull.tools.TemplateLink tool.request.page=org.apache.turbine.util.template.HtmlPageAttributes tool.request.content=org.apache.turbine.services.pull.tools.ContentTool tool.request.l10n=com.misys.portal.common.localization.Localization tool.request.convertTools=com.misys.portal.common.tools.ConvertTools tool.request.config=org.apache.turbine.Turbine tool.request.security=com.misys.portal.common.security.GTPSecurityCheck
#This pull tool is to allow for easy formatting of Date object into Strings tool.request.dateFormatter=org.apache.turbine.services.pull.util.DateFormatter
# Use this tool if you need a place to store data that will persist between # requests. Any data stored using this tool will be stored in the session. tool.session.sessionData=org.apache.turbine.services.pull.util.SessionData
# These are intake tools. #tool.request.om=org.apache.turbine.om.OMTool #tool.request.intake=org.apache.turbine.services.intake.IntakeTool
# This is a tool that allows access to the scheduler service. tool.request.scheduler=org.apache.turbine.services.schedule.SchedulerTool
#tool.global.ui=org.apache.turbine.services.pull.util.UIManager
# The UI Manager will allow you to skin your Turbine # application using simple properties files that are # located in the WEBAPP/resources/ui/skins/ directory # hierarchy.
#tool.ui.skin=default tool.request.gtpapp=com.misys.portal.common.tools.GTPApplicationData
# The content tool can put its URIs through the Servlet container, # which might attach things like the jsessionid even to URIs that # are not servered by the container. # # The default behaviour was not to put these through the container. # # Set this to true if you need things like jsessionid attached to all # links generated from the $content pull tool. # tool.content.want.encoding = false
# Both the link and the content tool normally return absolute URIs # You can change this by exchanging the tool classes but this is not # really recommended. Setting these properties to true allow you # to change the behaviour if you want only relative URIs (e.g. if you # run behind a reverse proxy or a load balancer). tool.content.want.relative = true tool.link.want.relative = true
section.para: Description : VELOCITY SERVICE -These are the properties for the Velocity Service.
section.programlisting:
services.VelocityService.earlyInit= true
# The location of Velocity configuration file, relative to webapp root # These properties will override the default properties set by Velocity. # You should specify the path to the templates directories as well as # the path to the log file and they should also be relative to webapp root services.VelocityService.template.extension=vm services.VelocityService.default.page = VelocityPage services.VelocityService.default.screen=VelocityScreen services.VelocityService.default.layout = VelocityOnlyLayout services.VelocityService.default.navigation=VelocityNavigation services.VelocityService.default.error.screen = VelocityErrorScreen services.VelocityService.default.layout.template = Default.vm
# Set this to true to catch Velocity Errors and display them in the log file services.VelocityService.catch.errors = true
services.VelocityService.runtime.log=/logs/velocity.log #services.VelocityService.input.encoding=UTF-8 services.VelocityService.velocimacro.library = GlobalMacros.vm services.VelocityService.velocimacro.library = macros/TurbineMacros.vm
# Set the following line to true to cause velocity to automatically reload # library macro files if they change. This is useful for debugging. services.VelocityService.velocimacro.library.autoreload = false
services.VelocityService.resource.loader = file services.VelocityService.file.resource.loader.description = Velocity File Resource Loader services.VelocityService.file.resource.loader.class = org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.loader.FileResourceLoader services.VelocityService.file.resource.loader.path = /templates services.VelocityService.file.resource.loader.cache = false services.VelocityService.file.resource.loader.modificationCheckInterval = 2
# Do not remove the class path loader lightly, it is used to load the TurbineMacros from VelocityOnlyLayout services.VelocityService.resource.loader = classpath services.VelocityService.classpath.resource.loader.description = Velocity Classpath Resource Loader services.VelocityService.classpath.resource.loader.class = org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.loader.ClasspathResourceLoader
section.para: Description : GTP DEFAULT TEMPLATE SERVICE -Used to get the ECS screen defaults.
Description : UPLOAD SERVICE -Whether the files should be automatically picked up by ParameterParser.
section.programlisting:
services.UploadService.automatic=true
# The directory where files will be temporarily stored. # Following default will use default application server directory #services.UploadService.repository=. # Following for non relative path (mind the '/') services.UploadService.repository=../tmp
# The maximum size of a request that will be processed. services.UploadService.size.max=1048576
# The maximum size of a request that will have it's elements cached in # memory by TurbineUploadService class. services.UploadService.size.threshold=10240
section.para: Description : LOCALIZATION SERVICE -Default ResourceBundle and language/country codes used by the TurbineLocalizationService.
section.programlisting:
# if true, the current localozation files are used to generate SQL scripts when the application launches localization.tool.generatescript=false # if true, the current localozation files are copied into the DB when the application launches localization.tool.populatedb=false
# persistence mode: either file-based or DB-based locale.default.bundle=com.misys.portal.common.localization.PortalBundle #locale.default.bundle=com.misys.portal.common.localization.db.DBPortalBundle
# default values locale.default.language=en locale.default.country=US
# This will set the charset= portion of the ContentType: header. # Leave commented out unless you want to return stuff as a different charset. locale.default.charset=UTF-8
section.para: Description : SCHEDULER SERVICE -Set enabled to true to start the scheduler. The scheduler can be stopped and started after Turbine has been initialised. See the Java docs for org.apache.turbine.services.schedule.TurbineScheduler for the methods calls.
section.programlisting:
services.SchedulerService.enabled=true
# Determines if the scheduler service should be initialized early. This # Should always be set to true!!!! services.SchedulerService.earlyInit=true
section.para: Description : POOL SERVICE -Default capacity of pools of the Object pooling service.
section.programlisting:
# Default: 128 services.PoolService.pool.capacity = 128 services.PoolService.pool.debug = true
# Class specific capacities used instead of the default if specified. #services.PoolService.pool.capacity.com.neomalogic.gtp.services.rundata.DefaultGTPRunData=512
section.para: Description : POOL SERVICE -Default capacity of pools of the Object pooling service.
section.programlisting:
# Default: 128 services.PoolService.pool.capacity = 128 services.PoolService.pool.debug = true
# Class specific capacities used instead of the default if specified. #services.PoolService.pool.capacity.com.neomalogic.gtp.services.rundata.DefaultGTPRunData=512
section.para: Description : FACTORY SERVICE.
section.programlisting:
# A comma separated list of classloaders (very optional) # Example: org.foo.bar.MyClassLoader, org.ack.joe.YourClassLoader #services.FactoryService.class.loaders=
# Customized factories to be used instead of the default factory. # E.g. to instantiate XML parsers, SSL sockets, etc., which require # specific instantiation not supported by the default factory. # The property name is prefixed with "factory" followed by the # name of the production class. The value is the class name of # the factory implementing the Factory interface. The factory # will be instantiated by using the service itself. # Examples: # services.FactoryService.factory.javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder=org.foo.xml.DomBuilderFactory # services.FactoryService.factory.javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser=org.foo.xml.SaxParserFactory # services.FactoryService.factory.java.net.ServerSocket=org.foo.net.SslServerSocketFactory
section.para: Description : XSLT SERVICE. This service used to transform the given XML based on the style sheet provided.
Description : PARAMETER PARSER.
section.programlisting: # This variable controls the case folding applied to URL variable names. # Allowed values: none, lower, upper # Default: lower url.case.folding=lower
section.para: Description : COMPONENT SERVICE. Components implementing the life cycle interfaces can be loaded, configured and initialized by Turbine
section.programlisting:
# Here you define the names of the various components to load. These # names are used as identifiers later so you can choose them freely. It # is, however, sensible to use the same names as the component projects # that you want to load. services.ComponentService.name = torque
# This is the class of the component to be loaded. # It must implement the org.apache.stratum.lifecycle.Initializable and # org.apache.stratum.lifecycle.Configurable interface to be loaded. # It may implement the org.apache.stratum.lifecycle.Disposable interface. # If it does, the Component is disposed at shutdown (Servlet destroy()) time. services.ComponentService.torque.classname = org.apache.torque.Torque
# This is the path to the Config file of the Component. It is relative # to the Root of the Application (either the Webroot given by the Servlet # Container or the Root given to TurbineConfig at startup time) # Note: relative to applicationRoot services.ComponentService.torque.config = /config/torque.properties
# Properties can be given directly to Components. This sets the "foo" # property for torque to "bar". #services.ComponentService.torque.property.foo = bar
section.para: Description : SESSION SERVICE.

Description : ADDITIONAL PROPERTIES.The full path name to an additional properties file. Properties in this file will be included in this property set. Duplicate name values will be replaced, so be careful.

section.programlisting:
#Online help dialect used by compass based the database #Oracle dialect compass.engine.store.jdbc.dialect=org.apache.lucene.store.jdbc.dialect.OracleDialect #MSSQL dialect #compass.engine.store.jdbc.dialect=org.apache.lucene.store.jdbc.dialect.SQLServerDialect #MySQL dialect #compass.engine.store.jdbc.dialect=org.apache.lucene.store.jdbc.dialect.MySQLDialect #HSQL dialect #compass.engine.store.jdbc.dialect=org.apache.lucene.store.jdbc.dialect.HSQLDialect
cache.object.max.life = 1800000
section.para: Description : HTTP Response Headers. Make sure that the key name and pattern is as below and don't keep any spaces in between the http.response.header. prefix. If you want to configure the same headers at web server/app server level, comment those headers from the below.
section.programlisting: http.response.header.X-Content-Type-Options = nosniff http.response.header.X-XSS-Protection = 1; mode\=block http.response.header.Strict-Transport-Security = max-age=16070400; includeSubDomains http.response.header.X-Frame-Options = SAMEORIGIN http.response.header.Cache-Control = no-cache\, no-store\, must-revalidate
section.para: Description : LDAP Security Service implementation. The following property specifies the security authentication type. Default value is simple.services.SecurityService.ldap.security.athentication=simple

Description : LDAP Security Service implementation. Give the providerURL along with host name and port number where the LDAP server is listening.services.SecurityService.ldap.providerURL=ldap://localhost:10389

Description : LDAP Security Service implementation. Give the user name of admin user, who is authorised to read from LDAP repository.# Characteres '/' are replaced by '=' and '%' are replaced by ','. # Default: none #services.SecurityService.ldap.admin.username=cn/Manager%dc/example%dc/com services.SecurityService.ldap.admin.username=uid/admin%ou/system
Description : LDAP Security Service implementation. Set whether the Admin password should be encrypted. Default value is true.admin.password.encrypted = true
Description : LDAP Security Service implementation. Enter the password of the admin user.# Default: none services.SecurityService.ldap.admin.password=

Description : LDAP Security Service implementation. Enter the class name of LDAP provider.# Default: com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory services.SecurityService.ldap.provider=com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory

Description : LDAP Security Service implementation. Enter the directory base to search.# '/' are replaced by '=' and '%' are replaced by ','. # Default: none services.SecurityService.ldap.basesearch=dc/finastra%dc/com services.SecurityService.ldap.user.search.filter=<SEARCH FILTER> services.SecurityService.ldap.dn.attribute=userPrincipalName
Description : Mandatory LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the user class with a class. Mandatory # Default: gtpUser services.SecurityService.ldap.user.class=gtpUser
Description : Mandatory LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the user name with an attribute in LDAP..# Default: gtpUserLogin services.SecurityService.ldap.user.username=gtpUserLogin

Description : Mandatory LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the company login with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: gtpCompanyLogin services.SecurityService.ldap.user.companyname=gtpCompanyLogin

Description : Mandatory LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the userPassword with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: userPassword services.SecurityService.ldap.user.password=userPassword
Description : Mandatory LDAP Security Service properties. Enter the unique ID. It must be an integer field.# Default: none services.SecurityService.ldap.user.userid=gtpUserUniqueId
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the active flag with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.active=gtpUserActvFlag
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the company ID with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.companyid=gtpCompanyId

Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the firstname with an attribute in LDAP. # Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.firstname=gtpUserFirstName
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the lastname with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.lastname=gtpUserLastName
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the email with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.email=gtpUserMailAddress
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the language with an attribute in LDAP.#Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.language=gtpLanguage
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the timezone with an attribute in LDAP. # Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.timezone=gtpTimeZone
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the country flag with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.country=gtpUserCountry
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the reference with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.reference=gtpUserReference

Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the address line 1 with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.address1=gtpUserAddress1

Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the address line 2 with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.address2=gtpUserAddress2

Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the address line 3 (dom) with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.address3=gtpUserAddress3
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the phone number with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.phone=gtpUserPhone
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the fax number with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.fax=gtpUserFax
Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the currency with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.currency=gtpUserCurCode

Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the last modified time with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.lastmodified=gtpUserLastModifiedTime

Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the creation date with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.created=gtpUserCreationDate

Description : Optional LDAP Security Service properties. This property maps the last login date with an attribute in LDAP.# Default: not mapped services.SecurityService.ldap.user.lastlogon=gtpUserLastLogon

section.title: torque.properties
section.para: This is the configuration file for Torque and these are database settings properties
section.note: Strings containing "," (comma) characters must backslash escape the comma (i.e. '\,')
section.para: Description : DEFAULT setting. The parameters to connect to the default database. MUST configure these properly.
section.programlisting: torque.database.default=default #Specify the database name to which application should connect # For Oracle torque.database.default.adapter=oracle # For MySQL torque.database.default.adapter=mysql
section.para: Description : CONNECTION setting. Sets the database configuration using JDBC. The user name and password are used for the database connections opened within the pool. The schema entry is case-sensitive; it gives the database schema holding all the database objects. Here's an example of these entries:
section.programlisting:
#Setup respective database driver and url. #Setup for Oracle database driver and url. torque.dsfactory.default.connection.driver=oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver torque.dsfactory.default.connection.url=jdbc:oracle:thin:@hostname:1521:gtp torque.dsfactory.default.connection.user=username torque.dsfactory.default.connection.password=password
#Setup for MySQL database driver and url. torque.dsfactory.default.connection.driver= com.mysql.jdbc.Driver torque.dsfactory.default.connection.url= jdbc:mysql://hostname:3306/synergie torque.dsfactory.default.connection.user= username torque.dsfactory.default.connection.password= password
section.para: Description : DATASOURCE setting. Below property specifies the Datasource details.
Description : CONNECTION POOL settings.Below are the properties for setting the connection pool for underlying database.
section.programlisting: # The number of database connections to cache per ConnectionPool instance (specified per database) #It may need to be adjusted to higher fine tuned values by the Database Administrator if the traffic on the #application grows drastically together with the probability of higher contention on the database access. torque.dsfactory.default.pool.maxActive=30 # The max wait time to get a connection (milliseconds) torque.dsfactory.default.pool.maxWait=30000 torque.dsfactory.default.pool.testWhileIdle=true # Connection validation setup torque.dsfactory.default.pool.testOnBorrow=true #Should configure database specific validation query torque.dsfactory.default.pool.validationQuery=SELECT 1 from dual # Eviction thread mecanism torque.dsfactory.default.pool.timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis=180000 torque.dsfactory.default.pool.numTestsPerEvictionRun=3 torque.dsfactory.default.pool.minEvictableIdleTimeMillis=1800000
section.para: Description : POOL BROKER settings.

Description : Determines if IDBroker should prefetch IDs or not. If set to false this property has the effect of shutting off the housekeeping thread that attempts to prefetch the id's. It also sets the of id's grabbed per request to 1 regardless of the settings in the database.Default: true
Description : Determines if the quantity column of the IDBroker's id_table should be increased automatically if requests for ids reaches a high volume.
Description : MANAGER USE CACHE. Determines whether the managers cache instances of the business objects. And also whether the MethodResultCache will really cache results.

section.section:
portal.properties
This is the configuration file for portal application.
Description : THREAD POOL SERVICE. Below properties allows to set the Thread pool setting
#This is a Service that provides a simple threadpool usable by all #thread intensive classes in order to optimize resources utilization services.ThreadPool.classname=com.misys.portal.services.threadpool.GTPThreadPoolService
#Specify the initial number of threads to create #Default: 20 services.ThreadPool.init.count=5
#Specify the maximum number of threads to create #Default: 100 services.ThreadPool.max.count=20
#Specify the minimum number of threads to keep as spare until you hit the max #Default: 10 services.ThreadPool.minspare.count=5
Description : PORTLET CACHE.
# TimeToLive.default = number of milliseconds an unused portlet will remain in cache. # Default 2700000 which is 45 minutes (45 * 60 * 1000) services.PortletCache.classname=com.misys.portal.core.services.portletcache.JetspeedPortletCacheService services.PortletCache.TimeToLive.default=2700000
Description : URLMANAGER SERVICE.
services.URLManager.classname=com.misys.portal.core.services.urlmanager .JetspeedURLManagerService services.URLManager.url=${applicationRoot}/tmp/urldatasources.properties
Description : PSML MANAGER SERVICE
# File-based PSML service, select (uncomment) this service (this is the default setting): #services.PsmlManager.classname=com.misys.portal.core.services.psmlmanager. CastorPsmlManagerService # To use the DB-PSML service, select (uncomment) this service, and comment out the above service: services.PsmlManager.classname=com.misys.portal.core.services.psmlmanager.db. DatabasePsmlManagerService services.PsmlManager.root=${applicationRoot}/content/psml services.PsmlManager.ext=.psml services.PsmlManager.mapping=psml/psml-mapping.xml # Default PSML services.PsmlManager.default-resource=default
#This service is responsible for loading and saving PSML documents. services.PsmlScreenManager.classname=com.misys.portal.common.services. ClsPathScreenPsmlManagerService #services.PsmlScreenManager.root=${applicationRoot}/config/psml/screen services.PsmlScreenManager.root=psml/screen services.PsmlScreenManager.ext=.psml services.PsmlScreenManager.mapping=psml/psml-mapping.xml
# Default PSML services.PsmlScreenManager.default-resource=default services.PsmlScreenManager.earlyInit= true services.PsmlScreenManager.scanRate=120
#The following property is used for DatabasePsmlManagerService only. The default is false that is #caching is not allowed with DatabasePsmlManagerService, as the current implementation of caching #does not work on a distributed environment. It works only in a single server environment. services.PsmlManager.caching-on=false #services.PsmlManager.default-resource=default.psml #services.PsmlManager.media-types=html:wml #services.PsmlManager.admin=admin #content.defaultencoding=iso-8859-1 content.defaultencoding=UTF-8
# only used by File-based PSML Manager # scan rate in seconds (every 2 minutes) services.PsmlManager.scanRate=120 # cache size - number of PSML pages to cache services.PsmlManager.cacheSize=100
# PSMLImportManager Service # The PsmlImportManager and PsmlManager should never be the same. # Select this service to import from File System to the Database # (make sure that DatabasePsmlManagerService is selected above) #services.PsmlImportManager.classname=com.misys.portal.core.services.psmlmanager. CastorPsmlManagerService # Select this service to import from the Database to the File System (make sure that CastorPsmlManagerService is selected above) services.PsmlImportManager.classname=com.misys.portal.core.services.psmlmanager.db. DatabasePsmlManagerService
Description : Additional PSML Properties.
# Base URL for fetching template psml # Note the syntax can be the following # psml.base.url=file:///data/psml/ psml.base.template.url=psml/templates
# Username used for anonymous access (this should map to a <username>.psml file # found in the psml.base.url directory) psml.base.username=default
# File used the store a portlet registry psml.registry.url=/psml/portletregistry.psml
#This service is responsible for loading and saving PSML documents AS PART creating customer through interface services.CompanyPsmlService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.services.PortalCompanyPsmlService
#For facility validation services.FacilityValidatorService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.facility.validation.FacilityValidatorServiceImpl services.FacilityProcessingCoreService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.facility.FacilityProcessingCoreServiceImpl services.FacilityProcessingCoreService.enable.pending.bank.facility.limit.oustandingamt = false
#For taking the mail format services.MailFormatterService.classname=com.misys.portal.interfaces.services.MailFormatterServiceImpl #format can be text/html,multiPart/mixture services.MailFormatterService.message.format=text/html # Property for the Maximum size of Attachment for Emails email.attachment.maxsize = 100000
Description : DAEMON FACTORY service
services.DaemonFactory.classname=com.misys.portal.core.services.daemonfactory .JetspeedDaemonFactoryService services.DaemonFactory.earlyInit= true
Below are the list of daemons
#provide a list of all daemon names #daemon.entry=feeddaemon #daemon.entry=diskcachedaemon #daemon.entry=badurlmanagerdaemon #daemon.entry=raterefresherdaemon #daemon.entry=cleanorphanattachmentdaemon #daemon.entry=filetogtpinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=bulkfiletogtpinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=bulkjmsinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=jmsinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=outputswiftinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=ftstogtpinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=retryinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=deferredsubmissiondaemon #daemon.entry=ti2mtpjmsinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=loaniq2mtpjmsinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=loaniq2mtpjmsinterfacedaemonhistoric # The daemon outputinterfacedaemon is required only when MTP is interfaced with TI 4.1.7 #daemon.entry=outputinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=mhub2mpjmsinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=essence2mpjmsinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=jmsinterfacedaemonopics #daemon.entry=jmsinterfacedaemonbankinvoice #daemon.entry=jmsinterfacedaemoncommonparty ###NOte: applicable only in case of listdef web service enabled with reporting options. #daemon.entry=wsreportcleanupdaemon #daemon.entry=loansyncupdaemon #daemon.entry=swiftbicmaintenancedaemon #daemon.entry=jmsinterfacedaemontreasury #daemon.entry=jmsinterfacedaemonliquidity
#daemon.entry=PTSAGBPPtsufiletogtpinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=PTSAGBPPTSUtsufiletogtpinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=v2PTSAGBPPtsufiletogtpinterfacedaemon #daemon.entry=v2PTSAGBPPTSUtsufiletogtpinterfacedaemon #Enable this daemon only in Bank side appdata. This changes are not required in Customer Side, #in case of multi-instance application configuration. #daemon.entry=reportschedulerdaemon #daemon.entry = autoacceptancedaemon
#Enable this daemon to keep the token alive by pinging (Only needed when SeamlessFxTokenService is enabled-Seamlessfx.properties) #daemon.entry=pingseamlessFxdaemon
daemon.pingseamlessFxdaemon.classname=com.finastra.portal.treasury.daemon.PingSeamlessFxDaemon daemon.pingseamlessFxdaemon.interval=20 daemon.pingseamlessFxdaemon.onstartup=true
#This daemon enables to Accept the Invoice Payable pending for approval daemon.autoacceptancedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.AutoAcceptanceDaemon daemon.autoacceptancedaemon.interval=3600 daemon.autoacceptancedaemon.onstartup=false
#Enable this daemon only in Bank side appdata.This changes are not required in Customer Side, in case of multi-instance application configuration. daemon.reportschedulerdaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.SchedulerRefresherDaemon daemon.reportschedulerdaemon.interval=120 daemon.reportschedulerdaemon.onstartup=true
daemon.loansyncupdaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.loan.daemon.impl.HistoricalLoanSyncupDaemon daemon.loansyncupdaemon.interval=3600 daemon.loansyncupdaemon.onstartup=true
# valid loantypes are ACTIVE \ ALL \ INACTIVE daemon.loansyncupdaemon.loantypes=ALL
Below are Feed Daemon related properties.
daemon.feeddaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.FeedDaemon daemon.feeddaemon.interval=1800 daemon.feeddaemon.onstartup=true
Below are Disk Cache Daemon related properties
daemon.diskcachedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.DiskCacheDaemon daemon.diskcachedaemon.interval=1800 daemon.diskcachedaemon.onstartup=true
Below are BADURLMANAGER Daemon related properties.Check for valid URLs within the BadURLManage
daemon.badurlmanagerdaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.BadURLManagerDaemon daemon.badurlmanagerdaemon.interval=1800 daemon.badurlmanagerdaemon.onstartup=true
Below are Rate Refresh Daemon related properties. This Daemon in charge of refreshing the currency rates stored in memory.
daemon.raterefresherdaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.RateRefresherDaemon daemon.raterefresherdaemon.interval=3600 daemon.raterefresherdaemon.onstartup=true
Below are Clean orphan Attachment Daemon related properties.This Daemon in charge of deleting files from attachment table where files are more than 2 days old.
daemon.cleanorphanattachmentdaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core. daemon.impl.CleanOrphanAttachmentDaemon daemon.cleanorphanattachmentdaemon.interval=30 daemon.cleanorphanattachmentdaemon.onstartup=true
#defined time will be applied to run the cleanorphanattachmentdaemon to clean the deleted file attachment form the DB, #in the format of "day,hour,minute" (comma separated) daemon.cleanorphanattachmentdaemon.deleted.file.time.day= 0 daemon.cleanorphanattachmentdaemon.deleted.file.time.hour= 0 daemon.cleanorphanattachmentdaemon.deleted.file.time.minute =3
Below are Incoming Interface Daemon related properties.This daemon responsible for polling a directory for messages. Messages are then inserted into database through the incoming interfaces.
daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.FileToGTPInterfaceDaemon daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interval=20 daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.onstartup=true daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.polled.directory=C:/dev/incoming/V5/polled daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.completed.directory=C:/dev/incoming/V5/completed daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.error.directory=C:/dev/incoming/V5/error daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.staticdata=xmlin daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.opicsdata=opics2portal daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.product=xmlin #Once the mhubportalcustomerin interface is merged with xmlin, we can comment the interface(mhubportalcustomerin) and start using xmlin #daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.product=mhubportalin daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.swift=swiftmt798output daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.tma=tsu2openaccount daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.swift.acknowledgement=swiftacknak daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.swift.deliverynotification=swiftdeliverynotification daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.banks=DEMOBANK daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.backoffice=
# This Daemon is responsible for uploading Swift BIC codes into the system. # To perform SWIFT BIC codes maintenance make sure 'daemon.entry=swiftbicmaintenancedaemon' is enabled # Remove the Headers from the file FI.txt # Specify the filename against 'interface.swiftbic.filename' that needs to be selected for BIC uploading process from the 'polled.directory' # Specify the SEPARATOR existence against 'interface.swiftbic.separator.exist' so that the related file-format parsing logic will be picked. # Default value for interface property 'interface.swiftbic.separator.exist' is 'false', if value is 'true' TAB separated file can be uploaded. daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.SwiftBicMaintenanceDaemon daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.interval=20 daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.onstartup=true daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.interface.name=bic2bankdata daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.interface.swiftbic.filename=FI.txt daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.interface.swiftbic.separator.exist=false daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.polled.directory=C:/dev/incoming/polled/swift daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.completed.directory=C:/dev/incoming/completed/swift daemon.swiftbicmaintenancedaemon.error.directory=C:/dev/incoming/error/swift
Below are Incoming MT94x Interface Daemon related properties.This daemon responsible for polling a directory for messages. Messages are then inserted into database through the incoming interfaces.
# incoming interfaces file daemon for processing MT94X messages daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl. FileToGTPInterfaceDaemon daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.interval=5 daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.onstartup=true daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.polled.directory=C:/dev/incoming/MT940/polled daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.completed.directory=C:/dev/incoming/MT940/completed daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.error.directory=C:/dev/incoming/MT940/error daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.swift=swiftinfiletoGTPinterface daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.swift.acknowledgement=swiftacknak daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.swift.deliverynotification= swiftdeliverynotification daemon.mt94xfiletogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.banks=DEMOBANK
Below are Bulk File Daemon related properties.This daemon responsible for polling a directory for messages. Messages are then inserted into database through the incoming interfaces.
daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.FileToGTPInterfaceDaemon daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interval=20 daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.onstartup=true daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.polled.directory=C:/dev/incoming/V5/polled daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.completed.directory=C:/dev/incoming/V5/completed daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.error.directory=C:/dev/incoming/V5/error daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.staticdata=xmlin daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.opicsdata=opics2portal daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.product=xmlin daemon.filetogtpinterfacedaemon.interface.swiftmigration=swift2021migxmlin
Below are JMS to Portal Interface Daemon related properties.This daemon responsible for polling a JMS Queue for messages from a JMS queue related to Bulk transactions. Messages are then inserted into database through the incoming interfaces.
daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal. core.daemon.impl.JMSToPortalInterfaceDaemon daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.factory=MPQueueCF daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.interval=60 daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.onstartup=true daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.queue=MPBulkReceiverQueue daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.secondary.factory=MPQueueCFSecondary daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.secondary.queue=MPBulkReceiverQueueSecondary daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.maxretryfailure=1 daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.interface.product=bulkxmlin daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.extension=xml daemon.bulkjmsinterfacedaemon.runonlyonmaster=false
Below are JMS to Portal Interface Daemon related properties.This daemon responsible for polling a JMS Queue for messages from a JMS queue. Messages are then inserted into database through the incoming interfaces.
daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core. daemon.impl.JMSToPortalInterfaceDaemon daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.interval=10 daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.onstartup=true daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.failsafe=true daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.error.directory=c://dev/outgoing/error daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.backup.directory=c://dev/outgoing/backup daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.backup.extension=xml #Related to Factory, Primary and secondary Queue daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.factory=MPQueueCF daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.queue=MPReceiverQueue daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.secondary.factory= daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.secondary.queue=MPReceiverQueueSecondary daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.maxretryfailure=1 daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.interface.product=xmljmsin daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.interface.swift=swiftin daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.interface.priorityQueueCounter=priorityQueueCounter daemon.jmsinterfacedaemon.interface.text.staticdata=
Below are TI to Portal Interface Daemon related properties.This daemon responsible for polling a JMS Queue for messages from a TI related queue. Messages are then inserted into database through the incoming interfaces.

Below are Deferred Submission Daemon related properties.This Daemon in charge of sending a submitted transaction through the interfaces at the defined issue date.The parameters for the deferred submission daemon are defined in the format XX.interfaces and XX.date.field, where XX is the product code that needs to be read, the .interfaces is the name of the interface chains to be called (comma delimited) and .date.field is the name of the date field to be checked to verify if it is the due date of the transaction (iss_date by default).
daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.DeferredSubmissionDaemon daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.interval=10 daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.onstartup=true daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.FT.interfaces=mhubxmlout\,beneficiarynotification daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.FT.date.field=iss_date daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.FT.date.field.skip=false daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.FT.ignore.BKchildFT=true daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.SE.interfaces=mhubxmlout daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.SE.date.field=tnx_val_date daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.SE.date.field.skip=false daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.BK.interfaces=mhubxmlout daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.BK.date.field=value_date daemon.deferredsubmissiondaemon.BK.date.field.skip=false

Description : REMOTE OBJECT STORAGE SYSTEM.Below are the list of related properties
Specify the directory that GTP Jetspeed should cache XML documents to for Win32 systems specify your directory as: cache.directory=d:/temp/GTPDocumentCache Default: /tmp/GTPDocumentCache
cache.directory=${applicationRoot}/cache
Specify whether GTP Jetspeed should fetch items that aren't in the DiskCache in real time. If true GTP Jetspeed will throw a ContentNotAvailableException when it encounters a URL that isn't available within the Cache. This can be used so that clients don't have to wait for URLs to download while using GTP Jetspeed. After the URL is first encountered GTP Jetspeed will create a thread to download this in the background Default: true
cache.require.cached=true
This value represents the maximum interval (in seconds) the system is waiting before a cached resource is automatically refreshed. This is particularly useful when dealing with external resources (such as RSS feeds) whose last modified date is not properly updated by their server Default: 3600 (one hour)
cache.time.validity = 3600
Description :Temporary Storage.Sometimes GTP Jetspeed wants to write out a file that may be necessary for further debugging. It will log the location and then write to this directory. #Default: /tmp
temp.directory=${applicationRoot}/tmp
Description :Public Remote Object Storage System.Specify where GTP Jetspeed should cache remote documents but that should also be public. An example of this would be an image that was loaded through a XML page from a remote server but is stored in this cache so that it can be loaded quicker GTP Jetspeed uses this to cache Images that it receives from XML documents. The content is parsed out and the images are placed in public.cache.directory so that users don't have to contact the server via another socket but can use the one they currently have to your HTTP server. This also works well if the original machine happens to be down when this request happens. The directory that you want your HTTPD to serve files from. This should be the public URL for the above document. Make sure your HTTP daemon has the correct permission to serve files from this directory. Default: /gtp-cache
public.cache.url=${applicationRoot}/cache
Description :Portlet Configuration.Defines the standard set of properties for GTP Jetspeed
#specify the default portlet control that should be instantiated #Default: portletcontrol.default.classname=com.misys.portal.core.portal.controls.MyTitlePortletControl portletcontrol.default.classname=com.misys.portal.core.portal.controls.GTPTitlePortletControl
#specify what default portlet controller should be instantiated #Default: portletcontroller.default.classname=com.misys.portal.core.portal.controllers. DefaultPortletController portletcontroller.default.classname=com.misys.portal.core.portal.controllers. DefaultPortletController
#Default: 100% defaultportletcontrol.width=100%
#Default: 3 defaultportletcontroller.numcolumns=3
#Default: 100% defaultportletcontroller.width=100%
defaultportletcontroller.pixelPadding=10 defaultportletcontroller.percentagePadding=1
Description :Automatic Portlet Creation.GTP Jetspeed can automatically create/instantiate all your Portlets and place them in the cache when it starts up.
autocreate.portlets=true
Description :GTP Jetspeed Content Publication. This section details the content providers used to serve the internal news and analysis. You should specify the content.root here. This should be a portion of a URL that is prefixed to all request.
content.root.url=/content
Description :Content Feeds.specify where GTP Jetspeed should get it's content feeds. This is setup like the following
#contentfeeds.feed.name=<name> #contentfeeds.feed.<name>.description=My Feed Description #contentfeeds.feed.<name>.url=http://server/url
#the XMLTree content feed #contentfeeds.feed.name=xmltree #contentfeeds.feed.name=10am #contentfeeds.feed.name=moreover
#feed meta info #contentfeeds.feed.xmltree.description=XML Tree OCS Feed ( http://www.xmltree.com ) #contentfeeds.feed.xmltree.url=http://www.xmltree.com/export/ocs.cfm
#contentfeeds.feed.10am.description=10.am OCS Feed ( http://www.10.am ) #contentfeeds.feed.10am.url=http://10.am/extra/ocsdirectory.xml
#contentfeeds.feed.moreover.description=Moreover OCS Feed ( http://www.moreover.com ) #contentfeeds.feed.moreover.url=http://w.moreover.com/categories/ocs/ocsdirectory.rdf
#The stylesheet used to transform OCS into PortletMarkup contentfeeds.stylesheet.url=/content/xsl/ocs.xsl
#GTP Jetspeed has the option to continually fetch all of its channels and keep them #in cache. The upside is that your clients will be able to see content #right away. The downside is that this results in more bandwidth used. #Setting it to false will cause slower page rendering due to GTP Jetspeed #having to go out and fetch your content. This option is chosen when no external #content is fetched at all. contentfeeds.fetchall=true
#The total number of portets to browse at once within GTP Jetspeed
#In preview mode... #Default: 15 contentfeeds.portletbrowser.preview.maxportlets=15
#In overview mode... #Default: 15 contentfeeds.portletbrowser.overview.maxportlets=15

# This is the class that implements the User interface. # You want to override this setting only if you want your User # implementation to provide application specific addtional # functionality. # Default: org.apache.turbine.om.security.TurbineUser # Class for User. services.GTPSecurityService.user.class=com.misys.portal.security.db.ExtendableGTPUserImpl # Class for Group. services.GTPSecurityService.group.class=com.misys.portal.security.db.GtpGroupImpl # Class for Role. services.GTPSecurityService.role.class=com.misys.portal.security.db.GtpRoleImpl # Class for Permission. services.GTPSecurityService.permission.class=com.misys.portal.security.db.GtpPermissionImpl # Class for UserTnx. services.GTPSecurityService.userTnx.class=com.misys.portal.security.db.ExtendableGTPUserTnxImpl
# This is the class that implements the Company interface. # You want to override this setting only if you want your Company # implementation to provide application specific addtional # functionality. # services.GTPSecurityService.company.class=com.misys.portal.security.GTPExtendedCompany
# This is the class that implements the Company interface. # You want to override this setting only if you want your Company # implementation to provide application specific addtional # functionality. # services.GTPSecurityService.companytnx.class=com.misys.portal.security.GTPExtendedCompanyTnx
# This is the class that implements the ACL interface. # You want to override this setting only if you want your ACL # implementation to provide application specific addtional # functionality. services.GTPSecurityService.acl.class = com.misys.portal.security.util.GTPAccessControlListImpl
# # This is the class that implements UserManager interface. # Override this setting if you want your User information stored # on a different medium (LADP directory is a good example). # Default implementation uses Peers and a relational database . # services.GTPSecurityService.user.manager=com.misys.portal.services.security.db.DBUserManagerWithObjectData
# Other available standard implementation: #services.GTPSecurityService.user.manager=com.misys.portal.services.security.DualUserManager #services.GTPSecurityService.user.customer.manager=com.misys.portal.services.security.db.DBUserManager #services.GTPSecurityService.user.bank.manager=com.misys.portal.services.security.db.DBUserManager
# # This is the class that implements CompanyManager interface. # Override this setting if you want your Company information stored # on a different medium (LADP directory is a good example).
#services.GTPSecurityService.company.manager=com.misys.portal.services.security.db.DBCompanyManager #services.GTPSecurityService.company.manager=com.misys.portal.openaccount.services.security.db.DBCompanyManager services.GTPSecurityService.company.manager=com.misys.portal.services.security.db.DBCompanyManagerWithObjectData
# # This is used by the GTPSecurityService to make the password checking # secure. When enabled, passwords are transformed by a one-way # function into a sequence of bytes that is base64 encoded. # It is impossible to guess the plain-text form of the password # from the representation. When user logs in, the entered password # is transformed the same way and then compared with stored value. # # Default: false #
services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords=true
# # This property lets you choose what digest algorithm will be used # for encrypting passwords. Check documentation of your JRE for # available algorithms. # # Default: SHA # if want to use SHA-256 then comment services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.algorithm=SHA # and uncomment services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.algorithm=SHA-256 #
services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.algorithm=SHA #services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.algorithm=SHA-256
#password_value field length (64 chars to 512 chars), by default 64 (SHA password algorithm) #change it to 128 if using SHA-256 password algorithm password.value.length = 64
# # This property lets you choose if you want the password to be # tested against the previous ones, and require the new password to be different. # Default (no history check): 0 services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.checkhistory=0
# These properties let you define the constraints of the password. services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.minlength=8 services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.maxlength=24 # charset is a regular expression and the complexity (in words) should be set accordingly in localization wherever applicable # e.g. "invalidPasswordCharError", "invalidPasswordError" key in common.js file services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.charset=^(?=.*?[a-zA-Z])(?=.*?[0-9])[a-zA-Z0-9]*$ services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.default=Password1 services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.autogenerate.charset=0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ services.GTPSecurityService.secure.passwords.autogenerate.tries=100
# Services (+properties) used for re-authentication # PasswordAuthenticationService --> Simple service that asks the user for his password again when submitting a transaction # NoAuthenticationService --> Empty service that always return true when authenticating ( #services.GTPAuthenticationService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.security.authentication.NoAuthenticationService services.GTPAuthenticationService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.security.authentication.PasswordAuthenticationService
services.GTPAuthenticationService.earlyInit=true services.GTPAuthenticationService.action.template=false services.GTPAuthenticationService.action.submit=true services.GTPAuthenticationService.action.return=false services.GTPAuthenticationService.action.reject=false
#When enabled only last authorizer and checker will get reauthentication reauth.last.authorizer.only.enabled = false
#Products to ignore last authorizer check for reauthentication. products.ignore.last.authorizer = IN,IP,CN,CR

# Customer Company initial administrator # (If not specified the default is admin) # Note this is an initial installation setup that shouldn't be updated afterward #customer.administrator = ADMIN
#Property to enable password and re-authentication client side encryption #allowed values are true and false #Default is true enable.client.side.password.encryption=true

# The properties below are used to create the description of goods # to be displayed made up from the data of the purhcase orders. # Note that the number of fields (Purchase Order and Line Item fields) and the one of headers # must be the same, so do not forget to synchronize them. # Purhcase order fields. product.po.fields.names = cust_ref_id # Line Item fields product.po.lt.fields.names = cust_ref_id product_name qty_val price_amt total_amt # Headers that are in the same order as the previous fields. # The format of this property is <LOCALIZATION_KEY>-l|r[c where l, r and c represent # the field alignement. "l" for Left, "c" for Center and "r" for Right. # Note the headers are always centered. product.po.fields.headers = PO_NUMBER-l PO_LINE_ITEM_NUMBER-l PO_LINE_ITEM_PRODUCT_NAME-l PO_LINE_ITEM_PRODUCT_QUANTITY-r PO_LINE_ITEM_PRODUCT_UNIT_PRICE-r PO_LINE_ITEM_PRODUCT_TOTAL_AMOUNT-r # Default issuer BIC for TSU messages product.tsu.issuer.bic.default = PTSAGBPP #product.tsu.issuer.bic.default = PTSAGBPPTSU

Description : DOJO Properties. Below are the set of dojo properties.
# Theme to extend, leave blank if using an independent theme dojo.css.base.theme = claro base
# comma separated list of URI path in which to look for built custom code # namespace will be resolved as the name of the last directory in the path dojo.modules.paths = /content/js/misys
# comma separated list of URI path in which to look for custom code source # namespace will be resolved as the name of the last directory in the path dojo.modules.paths.debug = /content/js-src/misys/
# Name of the layer for our custom code dojo.layers.custom=misys_common
# Execution modes are # # PROD - All resources will be loaded as layers from the content/js directory # DEBUG - Dojo/Dijit loaded as layers from content/js, custom code loaded as imports from js-src # DEBUG_ALL - All resources loaded as imports from js-src dojo.mode = DEBUG_ALL
#whether to include the firebug lite debugger, for IE dojo.firebuglite = false
# CDN URL for dojo # # Generally advised to use a CDN where possible, for performance reasons. # Comment this out to use a local copy. # NOTE: Can only be used with a XD build. ##dojo.cdn.url=https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/dojo/1.5/dojo/dojo.xd.js

Description : Node Identification Service. This service will be used in Customer and third party type installation to identify that Node will be a slave instance always. The customer/thirdparty type installation normally should not be used as master instance. .
# The service responsible for Identifying the Master instance in MultiInstance deployment of Misys Portal pointing to same database schema. # In the customer installation or thirdparty installation use SlaveOnlyInstanceService. # In the Bankside installation use MasterOnlyInstanceService if there is only one applicationserver/MP instance running # and use DBInstanceIdentificationService when multiple instance running which uses pessimistic locking # and use DBOptimisticInstanceIdentificationService when multiple instance running which uses optimistic locking. # when using DBOptimisticInstanceIdentificationService it is required to make sure that all the isntances time needs be same. # The acceptable difference is less than keep_alive_interval. # lock_acquire_interval : this indicate the time interval in milliseconds in which the slave instance need to check possibility of becoming master # keep_alive_interval: this indicate the time interval in milliseconds in whcih the master instance update the lock table to continue as master instance # lock_acquire_interval should be greater than keep_alive_interval. # lock_acquire_wait_secs indicate the time interval in seconds after which the timeout occur while acquiring lock or keep alive #
services.InstanceIdentificationService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.instanceid.MasterOnlyInstanceService #services.InstanceIdentificationService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.instanceid.SlaveOnlyInstanceService #services.InstanceIdentificationService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.instanceid.DBInstanceIdentificationService #services.InstanceIdentificationService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.instanceid.DBOptimisticInstanceIdentificationService #services.InstanceIdentificationService.earlyInit=true #services.InstanceIdentificationService.lock_acquire_interval=120000 #services.InstanceIdentificationService.keep_alive_interval=60000 #services.InstanceIdentificationService.lock_acquire_wait_secs=10

Description:PayeeReferenceValidationService. The service is responsible for Payee Reference Validation
# The service responsible for Payee Reference Validation services.PayeeReferenceValidationService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.payee.DefaultPayeeReferenceValidationService #services.PayeeReferenceValidationService.classname=com.misys.portal.common.payee.PayeeReferenceValidationServiceBankImpl services.PayeeReferenceValidationService.earlyInit=false
Description : Product Initializer Service. This service is used to have a single access point of product initialization. It can be used to customize certain aspects of product initialization with different implementations. For now only the FundTransferFile goes through this service to set parameters and choose style sheets based on the Sub Product Code. Future implementations might add other products.
services.ProductInitializerService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.services. DefaultProductInitializerService services.ProductInitializerService.earlyInit=true
Description : Product StopOver Service. This service is used to provide a pluggable point for a method to decide on rules to put a transaction in stop over (release queue in middle office) or not.Currently, two implementations are available. 1) com.misys.portal.product.services.DefaultProductStopoverService: Uses a parameter (P777) to decide based on bank, product and sub product if the transaction should go to stopover 2) com.misys.portal.product.services.NoStopoverService: Never puts a transaction in stopover
services.StopoverService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.services.DefaultProductStopoverService #services.StopoverService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.services.NoStopoverService services.StopoverService.earlyInit=true
Description : Product Loan StopOver Service. This service is used to provide a pluggable point for a method to decide on rules to put a transaction in stop over (release queue in middle office) or not.Currently, two implementations are available. 1) com.misys.portal.product.services.LoanProductStopoverService: Uses a parameter (P778) to decide based on bank, product and sub product if the transaction should go to stopover 2) com.misys.portal.product.services.NoStopoverService: Never puts a transaction in stopover
services.LoanStopoverService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.services.LoanProductStopoverService #services.StopoverService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.services.NoStopoverService services.LoanStopoverService.earlyInit=true
JMS Queue Message Priority This property sets the message priority for the message producer; must be a value between 0 and 9
queue_message_priority = 0
Cheque List Range This property sets range between From cheque number and To cheque number
