Description : Default Customer Status.
#Default customer status to be used, if in case the <CustStatus> in empty as part of the Incoming REG/CUSTDETAIL message #default.customer.status ---- default status set for the customer #default.customer.user.status ---- default status set for the customer user #The same 2 properties are also used in setting the default value at the UI level for new customer/user creation. #The value can be either active/inactive. default.customer.status=inactive default.customer.user.status=inactive
Description : New Customer Status.
#Access to the status option of the new customer and new user to be created from the UI can be controlled using the property #new.customer.status.access and new.user.status.access respectively #If value is set as TRUE then, the status is accessible(not readonly), any other value specified then the status option becomes readonly #Remember that the value is case sensitive new.customer.status.enabled=true new.user.status.enabled=false

customer.user.status.update=false

Description : Recurring Payment Configurable Option. This property will decide whether End Date is used in the Recurring Payments or Number of transfers. If true End date will be used, otherwise Number of transfers.
recurring.payment.by.endDate = false
Description:Additional fields in the company address. This property will add additional filed in the company address. Default is false.The deafult address field of company will be displayed. when true, the attitional field like Address Line1, Address Line2, City, County and Country code will be added in company address.
customer.addressfield.display.extended = false
Description:SSL Enablement. This property will specify whether SSL enabled
client.to.portal.ssl.enable = false
Description:Loan Amount Conversion flag. This property would check whether the backoffice wants a conversion of the loan amount into a negative amount or not. If true, negate the amount. Else update as it is.
services.backoffice.loanaccount.amount.convert=true
Description : Bill Payment Local Language. This property decides the language supported by the portal for Bill Payment other than the default language. For example, if the property is ar (arabic), then if the user language is also arabic, all the local labels will be shown for payee name, service name and references. If local labels are not present then the default language labels will be shown.
local.language = ar
Description : Account Summary Display. This property will check whether to display inactive account in the account summary screen on the customer side. The default value is true, which displays both active and inactive accounts in the account summary screen. If the value is set to false, only active accounts will be displayed in the account summary screen.
customer.inactive.accountsummary.display = true
Description : Inactive user account display. This property displays the inactive accounts in User Accout Feilds,Default is false customer.inactive.account.UserAccount.display = false
Description : Back Office Loan Account Amount Conversion Service.This property decides whether the amount obtained as Loan Account from the back office needs to be negated or stored as it is in the portal. Default value of this property is true. If set as true, the loan amount obtained is negated and stored in the database at the Portal. If set as false, the amount would be stored in the portal as it is.
services.backoffice.loanaccount.amount.convert=true
Description : Allow Non Pre-Approved Beneficiary Option.This property decides whether non-pre approved accounts are allowed. The default value is false. If this property is set to false, ensure that there are no non-PAB accounts in the system.
non.pre.approved.beneficiary.allowed = false
Description : Fund Transfer Financial Remittance Code and Description Display Service.This property checks whether to display the remittance code and remittance description for the Fund Transfer Financial Remittance (FI103,FI202). The default value is false. Set it to true if the remittance details need to be displayed on the Financial Remittance Screen.
services.fundtransfer.fi.remittance.display = false
Description:Charge account/charge account address fields enablement and disablement on customer profile screen. To enable/disable charge account and charge account address fields on customer profile screen. Default is false
customer.profile.charge_account.enabled = false
Description:Charge account Mandatory on customer profile screen. To toggle between mandatory and not mandatory for charge account if enabled Default is false
customer.profile.charge_account.mandatory = false
Description:Charge account/charge account address fields enablement and disablement on customer entities screen. To enable/disable charge account and charge account address fields on customer entities screen. Default is true
customer.entities.charge_account.enabled = true
Description:Charge account Mandatory on customer entities screen. To toggle between mandatory and not mandatory for charge account if enabled Default is false
customer.entities.charge_account.mandatory = true
Description:Non-pre approved accounts. This property controls whether non-pre approved accounts are allowed. Default - FALSE.
non.pre.approved.beneficiary.allowed = false
Description : Show Intermediate Bank Details in SWIFT Flag.This property decides whether to show the intermediate bank details for SWIFT transfers on both the Bank and Customer side. The default value is true. Set the value to true if you want to show intermediate bank details in SWIFT for MT103, MT101, FI103, and FI202 remittances.
remitt.mt103.enable.intermediary.bank.details = true remitt.mt101.enable.intermediary.bank.details = true remitt.fi103.enable.intermediary.bank.details = true remitt.fi202.enable.intermediary.bank.details = true
Description : Transaction Confirmation Details Display.This property checks whether to display the transaction confirmation details on the screen. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, ensure that the service TransactionConfirmationDetailsService.classname is not commented. The service to show confirmation details for transactions is services.TransactionConfirmationDetailsService.classname = com.misys.portal.product.services.TransactionSummaryService.
transaction.confirmation.details.enabled = false
Description : Password Migration Service. The service to migrate passwords for existing users Set password.migrationcompleted = true after migration has completed successfully and comment the two lines Un comment the below two lines and set password.migration.completed = false to run this service.
# Flag to indicate whether all passwords have been successfully migrated # IMPORTANT: Set this to true only when all the user passwords have been migrated as any user still having the earlier password encryptions will not be able to log in the system password.migration.completed=false
#services.PasswordMigrationService.classname=com.misys.portal.services.db.PasswordMigrationService #services.PasswordMigrationService.earlyInit=true
Description : Validation of Beneficiary based on Products. This property is included to skip the regular expression check for Beneficiary Name in Transaction related to Beneficiary Master Creation.This propetry includes the list of products , comma separated for bypassing validation for beneficiary name : for ex: beneficiary.validation.excluded.products = TPT\,DOM\,DD
beneficiary.validation.excluded.products = TRSRY\, MUPS
Description : Regular expression for validating beneficiary account number. regular expression for validating beneficiary account number.
beneficiary.validation.accountno.regex= ^[a-zA-Z0-9 ]{0\,34}
Description : Regular expression for validating beneficiary name. Shows the valid character set for beneficiary name If coma(,) is part of the regular expression, please put a \ before it. for eg. ^[a-zA-Z''-'\s]{1,40}$ becomes ^[a-zA-Z''-'\s]{1\,40}$
beneficiary.validation.regex = ^[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9 ]*$
Description : Regular expression for validating beneficiary address. If a backslash(\) is part of the regular expression, please put a total of Eight backslashes(\\\\\\\\).
beneficiary.validation.address.regex = ^[A-Za-z0-9 #\,''().?\/\\\\\\\\+-:]*$
Description: Regular expression for validating counterparty emailid
counterparty.validation.emailid.regex = ^([!#-'*+\\-\\/-9=?A-Z^-~]+ [.])*[!#-'*+\\-\\/-9=?A-Z^-~]+@[a-zA-Z0-9.-]+[\.]+[a-zA-Z0-9.-]+$
Description : IBANvalidation. This property is included in the IBAN validation check for Beneficiary Account no in Transaction related to Beneficiary Master Creation list of products , comma separated for IBAN validation for beneficiary Account no : for eg. beneficiary.IBANvalidation.included.products = MT103\\,MT101
beneficiary.IBANvalidation.included.products= MT103\,MT101
Description : Search Options Validations. This property is to display the * in the Search Options for Entity lookup of list screens. true - will display * in pop up screen false - won't display * in pop up screen
user.entity.search.with.wildcard = true
Description : Bank Group properties. allow.bankgroup.banks property is set to true if we want to allow bankgroup banks to be displayed for profile creation at Bankgroup level
allow.bankgroup.bank.operation=true

services.BeneficiaryUploadValidateService.classname=com.misys.portal.interfaces.services. beneficiary.upload.BeneficiaryUploadValidateServiceImpl beneficiary.upload.max.limit=10

Defaults to False enable.antivirus.errordescription.display=false # Default CRM mail id for customer users default.crm.email.address=portal@misys.com

Description : SWIFT validation. Regular Expression for validating Swift characters.If a backslash(\) is part of the regular expression, please put a total of Eight backslashes(\\\\\\\\).
swift.validation.regex= ^[a-zA-Z0-9 :\,\/\\\\\\\\'?#.+()\\r\\n-]*$
#Regular Expression for validating Swift characters- z character set.If a backslash(\) is part of the regular expression, please put a total of Eight backslashes(\\\\\\\\). # removed backslash(\) as this is not a valid swift char in x charset swift.validation.regex.zchar= ^[a-zA-Z0-9 :\,\/'?.+()\\r\\n=@#{!\"%&*;<>_-]*$

Description : Bulk Upload Payment MT103 beneficiary BIC code charset.Configuration property to specify Bulk Upload Payment MT103 beneficiary BIC code charset. It is important to keep in sync with the client side BIC code pattern defined in validateBICFormat method in \misys\validation\common.js.
swift.bic.charset=^[A-Z]{6\,6}[A-Z2-9][A-NP-Z0-9]([A-Z0-9]{3\,3}){0\,1}$

services.LIValidatorService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.validator.LIValidatorServiceImpl #foreign exchange services.FXValidatorService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.validator.FXValidatorServiceImpl #License services.LSValidatorService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.validator.LSValidatorServiceImpl services.BKValidatorService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.validator.BKValidatorServiceImpl #Financing Request services.TFValidatorService.classname=com.misys.portal.product.validator.TFValidatorServiceImpl #Shipping Guarantee Description : Add Duplicate Columns in a Report. This property determines whether duplicate columns can be added in report. Default value: false, By default duplicate columns are not allowed.
report.duplicate.columns.allowed=false
Description : Amount Conversion Rounding Mode. Rounding mode can take one of the integer values: BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP(4)/BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_DOWN(5)/BigDecimal.ROUND_DOWN(1) default Rounding mode is ROUND_DOWN(1)
amount.conversion.roundingmode=1
Description : Regular expression to configure the length of the Customer Reference. Regular expression to configure the length of the Customer Reference field in FT and Bulk Services/Trade Products/TreasuryProducts. Property also specifies the default length of the field. Maximum value 35. This regular expression allows all the characters.
#FT and Bulk Services customer.reference.cash.validation.regex = ^.{0\,16}$ customer.reference.cash.length = 16
#Trade Products. customer.reference.trade.validation.regex = ^.{0\,20}$ customer.reference.trade.length = 20
# All fields related to Name in trade products will be configurable, default length will be 35 name.trade.length = 35
#Regular expression to configure the length of the Customer Reference field FSCM Products. #Default length of the field is 16. Maximum value 35. This regular expression allows all the characters. customer.reference.fscm.validation.regex = ^.{0\,16}$ customer.reference.fscm.length = 16
#Regular expression to configure the length of the Customer Reference field PO Product. #Default length of the field is 16. Maximum value 35. This regular expression allows all the characters. customer.reference.po.validation.regex = ^[A-Za-z0-9]+$ customer.reference.po.length = 16
#Treasury Products. customer.reference.treasury.validation.regex = ^.{0\,20}$ customer.reference.treasury.length = 2
#Regular expression to configure the length of the Customer Reference field for Liquidity Back office Products. #Default length of the field is 20. Maximum value 35. This regular expression allows all the characters. customer.reference.lbo.validation.regex =^[A-Za-z0-9 #_-]{0\,20} customer.reference.lbo.length = 20
Description : Configure from where to pick Images for Email. There are two ways to pick images for email either from the docroot folder or DATA_3 of Parameter P760 which contains absolute path of the images to be picked. Default is to pick from Docroot folder.
email.image.from.relativepath=true
Description : Configure Relative path of Images included in Email. This property is to provide the relative path of the images to be include in the Email send by portal ,Currenctly it is a folder in the webapp/docroot/content. It can be configured to pick images from webapp/docroot/config also.
email.image.relativepath = /content/emailimages

Description : Configure BO Reference Id Regex. Default length of the field is 16. Maximum value 35. This regular expression allows all the characters.
gtp.boref.length.regex = ^.{0\,16}$

#Purge Daemon daemon.purgedaemon.classname=com.misys.portal.core.daemon.impl.PurgeDaemon # Once a day by default 86400 daemon.purgedaemon.interval=86400 daemon.purgedaemon.onstartup=true # Valid values are: DAY, MONTH, YEAR purgedaemon.period.unity=MONTH # Number of unities defined to be awaited. For example, 3 here and MONTH means that transactions older than 3 months will be pruged # Note that 3 MONTH is not the necessarily the same as 90 DAY. The method takes it in account. purgedaemon.period.quantity=24 purgedaemon.no.of.records.to.deleted.at.time=1000

section.title: log4j upgrade to log4j2
section.para:
As part of the Log4j upgrade, the following changes are made:
log4j.properties is changed to log4j2.xml that can be found in com.misys.portal.webapp\doc_root\config\log4j2.xml.
Log4j jars are upgraded from version 1.2.17 to 2.17.1 along with the dependable family jars.log4j-1.2-api-2.17.1 log4j-api-2.17.1 log4j-core-2.17.1 log4j-jcl-2.17.1 log4j-slf4j-impl-2.17.1
Slf4j.jar is upgraded from version 1.7.30 to 1.7.32.
Remove the following jar:slf4j-log4j12-1.7.32
All the above jars can be found in com.misys.portal.libraries/thirdparty.

To run the environment , you must make the following change:
Upgrade the turbine.jar to read log4j2.xml from appdata configuration for FCC application

Alternative configuration when FCC appdata configuration is not used:
Send the log4j2.xml’s path as an argument in the tomcat’s configuration, syntax of which is -Dlog4j.configurationFile=”{log4j2.xml path}”, for example:-Dlog4j.configurationFile=" C:\Workspace\Master\fbcc-5.x\com.misys.portal.webapp\doc_root\config\log4j2.xml"
Update the tomcat classpath with updated log4j jars and slf4j jars and commons-logging.
Clean the tomcat server thoroughly before publishing, restart eclipse if required.
If there are build path errors found, make sure to navigate to those projects and replace the non-existent old version jars with its corresponding new versions.
Logging can also be done through tomcat application. Add the following as a VM argument in the tomcat’s configuration, syntax of which is -Dlog4j.configurationFile=”{log4j2.xml path}”, for exampleExample: -Dlog4j.configurationFile="C:\Workspace\Master\fbcc-5.x\com.misys.portal.webapp\doc_root\config\log4j2.xml"

section.title: restapi.properties
section.para: This configuration file is used to configure stateful\stateless protocol for Rest API services

Description: This property is used to enable rest service for FCCrestapi.enabled=false
This property value should be set to true to enable APIs for Issued Undertaking, Recieved Undertaking, Modern Dashboard and OpenAPI.

Description:This property is used to decide whether restapis should use session or not for API calls (This property is not considered when OIDC is enabled)restapi.use.stateful.session = false
This property value should be set to true to enable APIs for Issued Undertaking, Recieved Undertaking, Modern Dashboard and OpenAPI.
Description:This property is used to to enable/disable OIDCoidc.enabled = false
Description:This property decides whether to take the company name from the token or notoidc.companyname.passed=false

Description: The following company mappings are considered when oidc.companyname.passed is set to false. #oidc.dev.user.USER1=DEMOCOMP #oidc.preprod.user.USER1=DEMOCOMP #oidc.dev.user.USER3=TATA #oidc.preprod.user.USER1=TATA #oidc.dev.user.USER4=TATA #oidc.preprod.user.USER1=TATA oidc.dev.user.FFDCUSER1=SCOTTLEVER oidc.dev.user.FFDCUSER2=SCOTTLEVER
Description: Set the below property false and set the keystore details while using FCC as IDPoidc.jwt.internalstore = true
Description: Set the Keystore details belowoidc.jwt.keystore = D:/KeyPair/jwtstore.jks oidc.jwt.keystore.password = password oidc.jwt.keypair.alias = jwt oidc.jwt.keypair.password = password

Description: The following property lists the end points used prior loginoidc.excluded.restapi.endpoints=/restportal/oauth/jwks.json,/restportal/login/**, /restportal/getaccesstoken,/restportal/getConfigurationDetails,/restportal /generateKeys,/restportal/configuration
Description: Set the URI from the oidc auth providerspring.security.oauth2.resourceserver.jwt.jwk-set-uri=http://localhost:9090/restportal/oauth/jwks.json

Description: Set the following oidc detailsoidc.client.id = 74c103fd-3deb-48ff-ab55-9f07b529b466 oidc.client.secret = 534674d9-c97b-454c-83a4-9d9b9df3d92b oidc.scopes = openid oidc.resource.ids = oauth2-resource
Description: The following property is user_name in FCC, preferred_username in the keycloak and user name in FFDCoidc.username.claimfield = user_name oidc.username.compabbvname.separator = ##
Description: Value of the authorization grant type("password", "authorization_code", "refresh_token")oidc.authorization.granttype = authorization_code,refresh_token
Description: The following property is the to which client should redirect to after successfully getting the authorization code oidc.redirect.uri = http://localhost:8180/home
Description: The following property configures the access token validity in secondsoidc.accesstoken.validity = 300
Description: The following property configures the refresh token validity in secondsoidc.refreshtoken.validity = 600
Description: The following property is restapi response success code flagrestapi.response.successcode = true
Description: The following property is URL to get auth code(change the URL according to your deployment environment)oidc.auth.url= http://localhost:9090/restportal/oauth/authorize

Description: The following property is URL to get access token (change the URL according to your deployment environment)oidc.token.url= http://localhost:9090/restportal/oauth/token ux.client.id = 508e969e-228c-4564-b97b-459e904bd1da ux.client.secret = 64940f01-c5f3-4138-bb32-baaaa864b465 ux.redirect.uri = http://localhost:8180/login ux.accesstoken.validity = 3600 ux.refreshtoken.validity = 7200
Description: The following property is used to configure token enablementux.enable.get.token = false

Description: The following property is URL to get access token by using user defined rest API (change the URL according to your deployment environment)ux.get.token.url = http://localhost:9090/restportal/getaccesstoken
Description: The following property is well known URL from any OIDC auth provider.wellknown.url.for.b2b.api.jwt.validation = http://localhost:8180/auth/realms/b2b_api/.well-known/openid-configuration

Description: The following property is regular expression validation on input string, where user has provided input has HTML Tags on OpenAPI requestopenapi.encode.message.regex = <(?:[^>=]|='[^']*'|=\"[^\"]*\"|=[^'\"][^\\s>]*)*>

Description: The following properties are used to configure Rest API documentationdocumentation.services.fbcc.enabled=false documentation.services.fbcc.version=1.0 documentation.services.fbcc.title=FBCC Portal Rest APIS

section.title: Localization Files
section.para: is localized through dedicated property files stored under the . /resources/../localization directory under the root of the webapp directory tree.
Each language supported by has set of specific property files, labelled the following way:
core_<language code>.properties, trade_<language code>.properties, cash_<language code>.properties, loan_<language code>.properties, treasury_<language code>.properties
Label specific to a module can be refer from corresponding files (example trade specific can be found in trade_en.properties).
The localisation files structure follows the standard key = value format, value being the localized text.

Javascript specific localization file can be found under webapp in doc_root\content\js-src\misys\nls\<language code>\common.js. This contains all javascript specific message label for all modules (trade, cash, loan, treasury, common).

section.title: Overview
section.para: The Audit module is customisable through a dedicated property file stored under the . /config directory under the root of the webapp directory tree:

This configuration file is used by the audit system in order to detect which action should be audited: each event in the portal is assigned a level that sets its criticality and importance, and a reference level indicates up to which level the events are logged.

section.title: Audit Level
section.para: The audit property file contains three kinds of parameters:
The reference audit level, that sets the minimum level to be audited. If an action's audit level is less than or equal to the reference level, the action is logged:
The default audit level is the default level used when an action level isn't specifically defined in the properties file:
The audit level of each auditable action:

When an auditable action occurs, the audit system compares the action's audit level to the reference level in order to decide if the action should be logged for audit: if the action's audit level is less than the Reference Level, the action is logged.
When an action hasn't an associated audit level in the property file, the default audit level is used instead.

The above examples define that the Login action, which has an audit level of 1, should be logged since the reference level (i.e. 2) is greater or equal. If an action occurs that is not listed in the property file, the default audit level is used (i.e. 3), and thus the action is not logged since this default level is greater that the reference level (i.e. 2).

section.title: Audit Purge
section.para: The audit mechanism logs the audit data in a dedicated database table, the administrator being responsible and in charge of the purging this data. In order to ease this process, a script file is provided under the . /scripts directory under the root of the webapp directory tree:
The script takes a number of days passed as input parameter, and deletes from the audit trail table all records older than the number of days specified (based on the record timestamp).

section.title: Usage
section.para: Where <connection_string> provides the username/password and database instance to connect to and <nb_days> is an integer specifying the number of days of retention.

section.title: Example
section.para: The script connects to gtp instance as scott/tiger, and deletes all audit records older than 30 days.

section.title: Audit Exclude
section.para: The following property configures the fields to be excluded from being audited (comma seperate values)

section.title: Content Directory Tree
section.para: This section provides a quick overview of the tree under the ./content directory. These files constitute a key portion of the software and must not be modified without prior consultation of the support team. Manual maintenance or adjustments must be restricted to those items described specifically below, as allowing a customisation by the local technical administrator.

Contains default.css
default.css the cascading style sheet definition used throughout the pages
calendar.css the cascading style sheet definition used throughout the calendar

For a file-based PSML management, this is the central store where the portal can obtain information about the user interface components (or so-called portlets) registered in the system. For each bank and customer, and each language handled in the system, a .psml file defines how the home page is organised and what presentation properties it will use.
The following chapter will provide the different types of files included as well as the changes allowed to their internal content.
Static HTML pages are stored here.

The internal news content providers are stored in XML files bearing a format described in a following chapter of this document. As described above, the file neomalogic-content.xml is the example content used by the content provider named neomalogic.
The various images used by the portal are stored here.

section.title: Internal News Content Providers
section.para: As described in the portal.properties file, the news feeds that the bank provides to its users and can maintain through the Web interface of the is actually based on a simple XML file that not only contains the news items but also the list of topics available and their related visuals.
The XML structure of the content files is driven by the following DTD:
section.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!ELEMENT content (channel)> <!ATTLIST content version CDATA #REQUIRED > <!ELEMENT channel (topics, item+, title, link, description)> <!ELEMENT topics (entry+)> <!ELEMENT item (topic, title, link, description)> <!ELEMENT entry (image)> <!ATTLIST entry name CDATA #REQUIRED > <!ELEMENT image (title, url, link, width, height)> <!ELEMENT title (#PCDATA)> <!ELEMENT url (#PCDATA)> <!ELEMENT link (#PCDATA)> <!ELEMENT width (#PCDATA)> <!ELEMENT height (#PCDATA)> <!ELEMENT description (#PCDATA)> <!ELEMENT topic (#PCDATA)>
section.para: The root of such XML files is a content element, directly followed by a single child element called channel. Besides containing a reminder of its title, of a link to an external web site representing its overall content and a description, this channel mainly holds two types of information:

listitem.para: The single topics element which has an entry per type of information (or topic) that the bank's administrator can choose to add when maintaining the news feed through the Web interface.

section.para: Within this entry element, only the image used as a visual for that topic is further defined through its title (acting as a fly-over tool tip when the mouse cursor is above it), the URL indicating to the system where to find the related image file, the link pointing to the URL of the page opened when the user clicks on the topic, and optionally the width and height of that image.

listitem.para: The item elements representing the current content of the news feed, and thus the articles displayed on the Home page of the registered users.

section.programlisting: <item> <topic>neomalogic</topic> <title>Happy New Year!</title> <link>http://www.neomalogic.com/newyear.html</link> <description>Misys is wishing a Happy New Year to all its customers, partners and staff. The usual annual cocktail will be held in its premises for this occasion.</description> </item>
section.para: Each item is tied to a topic (to be found among the entry elements of the topics described above), a title which acts as a header for the news items and hyperlink opening a new browser's window on the page specified by the link element, and finally a description element which holds the actual content of the news item.
The technical administrator can therefore typically be asked by the bank's functional administrator to:

listitem.para: Create a new content provider and thus a new internal news channel by adjusting the portal.properties file and create an XML file conforming with the DTD and rules above,
Add a new topic on an existing content provider by inserting a new entry child element under topics and associating it with the requested image,
Perform some clean-up in case such an action is not available for any reason through the Web interface, or simply to delete a content provider.

section.para: The standard distribution of comes with samples of such content providers that can be used as templates for the creation of additional channels.

section.title: PSML Files
section.para: The PSML acronym used here stands for Portal Structure Mark-up Language. The format used in is derived from a format originally created as part of the Java Apache Project to allow the definition of content structure in a portal framework. It has been adapted here to fit the requirements of the Misys trade platform.

This document intends to provide the reader with an overview of the files involved and to highlight some specific items of the configuration that can eventually be adjusted by the bank's technical administrator. The goal of this guide is not to provide a developer-oriented description of these resources that should not be modified without prior written agreement of the support team.

section.title: Portlet Registry
section.para: The Portlet Registry acts as a central repository for by containing the summary definition of all the user interface components that can technically make up the pages of the portal.

The only modification allowed currently in the portletregistry.psml file is the addition of eventual internal news content providers (see the previous section for more details) following the RSS format (Rich Site Summary, originally developed by Netscape).
The entries referring to the internal news content providers can be added at the end of the file and must have the following format:
section.programlisting: <entry type=" ref" name="NeomalogicContent" parent="JetspeedContent"> <parameter name="provider-name" value="neomalogic"/> </entry>
section.para: The values in bold in the above example must not be changed, they are ensuring that the added entry will be recognised by as a valid internal feed to offer to the bank's functional administrator while creating customers and their home page through the Web interface.

The name associated with the entry of type instance is what will be displayed on the bank's administrator screen, and the value of the provider-name must be equal to a content provider entry defined in the portal.properties file.

The additional information to be defined is the name of this feed as shown to the functional administrator and appearing here as an attribute of the entry element, the url to connect to in order to fetch the regularly updated RSS feeds, a title that will appear as the header of the news feed within the user's home page and an optional description.

section.title: PSML Company Files
section.para: For a file-based PSML management, the PSML files found in the ./content/psml directory are representing the structured views of the content offered to a given company (whether a bank or a customer's company) identified through its Home page.

For each company, a different PSML definition will be automatically generated for all the languages defined within the system. For instance, with the configuration associated with the English language, the following file will be found:

Hence, even within the same company, different user interfaces can easily be produced to reflect the specific requirements of International Trade users with a given language. Note that the number of languages handled depends on the existence of templates for each language.
When accessing the default Home page as a non-authenticated user, the default.psml configuration file is loaded.

section.title: PSML Templates
section.para: When a new company is created, the technical administrator does not need to perform any task as a prerequisite, and the whole process of such creations is solely under the responsibility of the functional administrator.

In order to automatically create the structure of a new company's home page, is relying on PSML templates for both the bank and client's roles. These files are found in the ./config/psml/templates directory.

If the functional administrator requires the default number of items to be shown on some specific lists of the online screens to be updated, the technical administrator can perform those changes within these files by adjusting the following entries. This is the only type of change allowed on the PSML templates internal structure.

entry.para: Within the customer's home page, this component handles the list of events for the day, of last pending transactions and of last notifications. The number of items listed in each category can be adjusted here, with respectively the parameters max_event (default to 99), max_pending (default to 5) and max_notification (default to 5).

entry.programlisting: <entry type="ref" parent="TradeEventsPortlet"> <parameter name="max_event" value="99" type="int"/> <parameter name="max_pending" value="5" type="int"/> <parameter name="max_notification" value="5" type="int"/> ... </entry>

entry.para: Within the bank's home page, this entry handles the display of the most recent transactions received from the customers. The parameter max_apps can be adjusted according to the requirements (default to 10).

Similarly, this entry handles the display of the most recent requests received from the customers through the CRM feature. The parameter max_requests can be adjusted to set the number of last such items returned (default to 10).

section.para: Note that such changes will not alter all the companies created prior to them, the templates being only used as models during the initial creation of the company. Also, if any of the parameter above is not given in the PSML file, a default value of 5 will always be used by the system.

section.title: XSL FO Files
section.para: XSL FO stylesheets are used in the to build and return Adobe Acrobat PDF documents to the client.

section.title: EC Cover Letter
section.para: The customisable style sheet /content/xsl/fo/ ec_coverletter.xsl is used to generate a Cover Letter for an Export Collection transaction.

In order to adjust the Cover Letter format, the style sheet can be edited. For example, the displayed logo can be changed by specifying another image URL (the original URL is ./content/images /advices/logo.gif). Margins may also be set to fit the printer requirements.

It can be required to provide the companies with a custom style sheet per bank they are dealing with. For that purpose, the filename is abbreviated bank name sensitive, meaning that the abbreviated name of the remitting bank of an Export Collection can be used as prefix for a style sheet filename.

The directory where style sheets are stored may contain several files. The ec_coverletter.xsl must exist in order to provide the default behaviour. When the client requests for the Cover Letter of an Export Collection transaction, the stylesheet tied to the remitting bank is first searched. Its name must start with the remitting bank abbreviated name, followed by the _ec_ coverletter.xsl token.

For example, if a bank MyBank exists and is used as the remitting bank of a given Export Collection, the file named: MyBank_ec_coverletter.xsl may exist and will be used to generate the Cover Letter. Otherwise the default resource ec_coverletter.xsl is used.
Since the default file ec_coverletter.xsl always exists, it is not necessary to create a style sheet per bank.

section.title: PDF Exports
section.para: From every popup window presenting transaction details, the capability to print those details is available, as well as exporting them as PDF files.

The related stylesheets are in /content/xsl/fo/<product_code>_fo.xsl and can eventually be customised. For example, the logo displayed can be changed by specifying another image file (the original URL for this image is ./content/images /advices/logo.gif). The colours can also be adjusted in fo_commons.xsl.
